data.text:
As Canadians, we're well-versed in the art of navigating wild weather fluctuations. Today is yet another prime example - from the gripping cold out west to the milder embrace of Quebec... and gearing up for an impressive gust of wind and snow tonight. Our resilience in the face of these rapid changes reflects not just on our personal mettle, but our business acumen too. We plan, we adapt, and most importantly, we carry on with a smile and determination, ready to conquer whatever mother nature throws at us next! #CanadianWeather #Resilience #businessadaptability

In light of the devastating events in Morocco, we turn our focus to the enduring hope found in the expertise of skilled Moroccans like Ayoub Belouch. Ayoub advocates for a safer, more resilient future. “In the face of this disaster, we're reminded that challenges remain; the difficulties we've faced offer us an opportunity to build back better and safer communities. To tackle these challenges head-on, we're rigorously examining every failure mode we encounter, peeling back the layers to understand root causes. This deep dive redefines our strategies and pinpoints the most effective interventions. What comes next? We're evaluating affected regions and refining our understanding of the issues at hand. By quantifying the extent of the damage and taking into account both human and cultural factors, we can extract wisdom, establish best practices rooted in time-tested, ancient earthquake-resilient techniques, and train master masons who will, in turn, instruct others in reconstruction efforts.” - Ayoub Belouch Despite facing ongoing challenges, he remains hopeful for the future, believing that local expertise can help reshape strategies and establish new best practices.

Discussing #CivilProtection challenges with #Japan's 🇯🇵 #Ambassador in #Cyprus Mr. YAMAWAKI Yoshio and its delegation, during their visit at the premises of European University Cyprus / CERIDES - Center of Excellence in Risk and Decision Sciences. We were particularly excited to listen to Dr. Narumi Takahashi, from the National Research Institute for Earth Science and Disaster Resilience of Japan, explaining the cutting-edge development and use of #earlywarning systems for #earthquakes and #tsunamis in Japan. Japan is one of the most well-prepared countries of the world when it comes to disasters, especially with regards to earthquake and tsunami #hazards. We are looking forward to our increased scientific #collaboration and exchange of #bestpractices with Japanese experts from both the academic and administrative domains! #Gaziantep is the host city of the upcoming #Horasis Global Meeting, 22-23 October. Mayor Fatma Şahin invited Horasis to stage this major economic summit. Gaziantep and the southern region of #Türkiye were hit by a massive earthquake earlier this year. Members of the #Horasis community are invited to propose solutions to reconstruct the city. ❓ What is the critical listing of needs from buildings to purposeful changes in societal practices? ❓Can the changes be done rapidly, or must we reflect deeply on purposefulness and the people’s needs?
